page.title: 13Transport in Calbourne
page.content: The Southern Vectis Omnibus Company control all the local{BUS}routes. There are about nine buses in either direction to the nearest towns each day. In the summer the cost of travel rises by 12%. A single ticket to Newport in 1985 costs eighty five pence per adult. A small minority of residents, tourists and school children rely on the bus service. A choice of{TAXI}services are available from Newport or Yarmouth. The majority of working people have a {CAR}or the use of a car. The cost of petrol is #2.oo per. gallon. A few young men and women use{MOTORBIKES.} {BICYCLES}and{HORSES}are both now used for leisure purposes. Many local people are keen{WALKERS.}
